title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top NFL Draft prospect, is excited about potentially being mentored by Tom Brady with the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, a quarterback from Indiana, won the Heisman Trophy and led Indiana to a College Football National Championship victory.
Despite being favored as the No. 1 pick for the Raiders, Mendoza remains open to joining any NFL team selecting him.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez, streaming on Hulu, is based on a Tony Award-winning musical.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run', a Beatles documentary by Morgan Neville, is available on Prime Video.
Season 4 of 'Bridgerton', featuring a Cinderella-like plot, is now streaming on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a spring training game against the Braves.
Despite the collision, both players stayed in the game, with Anthony hitting a single and Rafaela a two-run homer.
The collision was attributed to miscommunication, but neither sustained significant injuries, according to team manager Alex Cora.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund once a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
The donation will be Cora's largest single contribution to the Boston-based cancer research organization.
In previous seasons, Cora has made donations based on win counts and runs scored by the Red Sox.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, targeting critical race theory and LGBTQ+ topics in schools, 184–164.
The bill bans teaching division-promoting content, requiring education to support a neutral or patriotic perspective.
Teachers violating the bill could face credential revocation and schools may be sued for up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are created using food coloring, a tradition spanning decades.
The Hairpin Turn on the Mohawk Trail offers scenic views and is a popular photography spot in winter.
The tradition uses supersoakers or water balloons to add color, with local participation dating back over 60 years.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts reports its first two measles cases of 2026, involving a school-aged child and a Greater Boston adult.
The Boston-area adult visited locations while infectious; health officials are notifying potential exposed individuals.
Measles risk remains low in Massachusetts due to high vaccination rates despite a national outbreak of over 1,136 cases.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, a lifelong South Boston resident, passed away at 33 on February 21, 2026.
Morgan is survived by her husband Francis Vitiello and her children, Mya and Frankie.
Visiting hours are on March 3, 2026, at George F. Doherty & Sons Wilson-Cannon Funeral Home in Dedham.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor her late father.
Her father, a salesman in Boston, passed away from ALS when Lauren was 25 years old.
Hamilton aims to raise awareness and hope for better treatments for ALS through her marathon run.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion after AG Andrea Campbell moved to strike her Legislature audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio's lawsuit demands compliance from legislative leaders for an audit supported by a 72% voter-approved measure.
AG Campbell argues DiZoglio lacks authority to sue, citing separation of state powers and her office's gatekeeping role.
